answers.answer: sounds like your sugar is low. you got any peanut butter on hand?
Yeah should i go eat some peanutbutter?
Yeah I think the orange juice was a good idea, but I would try eating something too. Sounds like a sugar low to me too.

yeah eat some peanut butter, bread is also good. Make a peanut butter sandwich and lay down :) you should start feeling better soon. But make note of this so you can tell your doctor. It may be a GD sign :/
What does that even mean? A sugar low? ah do i have gestational diabetes?!?!
no silly! your doctor has to test you for that. it may just be some freak occurrence or your body is telling you to eat, mine does that if I don't eat every 2-3 hours now.
I get tested tomorrow for it but i just threw up is that bad?

Actually it could be a sign of too much sugar, especially if you are feeling tired. I think you should go see your doctor, urgent care or the er to get your blood sugar tested immediately. It could be dangerous to eat or drink more sugar if you are actually high sugar right now.
Ugh now im freaking out even more! What do i do?! I dont have a way to the dr my fiance works almost 2 hours away he has our only car. ugh.
Try just calling your doctor or health care provider and describe everything you are feeling. They can recommend what to do.
The only number I know is the number to call to make an appointment and stuff.
Just call that then and tell them it's an emergency that you need your doctor to call you back immediately. They should call back soon.
Just talked to the nurse and she said to take it easy and drink fluids and eat some crackers or something which i dont have. ugh.

Bread is a good substitute for crackers. You can toast it or not, no butter or anything, just plain. I hope you feel better soon. If you start to feel hungry make sure to eat something easy like soup. It could just be dehydration and stress so make sure to drink plenty of water and relax. Wishing you the best hun. Message me anytime.

Drink plenty of water. Your Dr. should have an after hours emergency line too. They generally don't test for GD until 27 weeks, unless you are over weight or at risk for diabetes. Drink water, take a warm bath and take it easy. Good luck!

Im getting tested early bc im highrisk. im asian, im "overweight" by the doctors side, but im not fat. idk how to explain that. also my dads side of the family has diabetes. thanks ladies youve all calmed me down a lot
I hope u get to feeling better. had a weird spell today that lasted about 10 min. still not sure what that was

question: I cant stop shaking idk whats going on. i drank some orange juice to see if it helped but im laying down now. idk if im freaking myself out or what. and im so tired, i just want to sleep or something. im 18wks1day
title: im really scared
